chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Our board class. Functions as a utility class for controlling the chess board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
        Initializes the board with pieces. Then, it calls calculateAll().

      • calculateAll

        public static void calculateAll()
        Calculates all possible moves and takes of all pieces (except for kings). Also accounts for pawns taking differently than they move. Then calls calculateKings().

      • calculateKings

        public static void calculateKings()
        Calculates all possible moves and takes of kings.

      • getRow

        public static Piece[] getRow(int row)
        Gets a row of pieces from the board for any given row.
        Parameters:
        row - the row number as an index
        Returns:
        the array of Piece objects determined by row index

      • getCol

        public static Piece[] getCol(int col)
        Gets a column of pieces from the board for any given column.
        Parameters:
        col - the column number as an index
        Returns:
        the array of Piece objects determined by column index

      • getBoard

        public static Piece[][] getBoard()
        Gets the whole chess board as a 2D array.
        Returns:
        a 2D array of Piece objects

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard()
        Prints the whole chess board.

      • getPiece

        public static Piece getPiece(int i,
                             int j)
        Gets the piece at a given spot. Determined by indexes.
        Parameters:
        i - the desired row index
        j - the desired column index
        Returns:
        a Piece object at the given spot

      • getPiece

        public static Piece getPiece(Point p)
        Gets the piece at a given spot. Determined by a Point object.
        Parameters:
        p - a Point object indicating the desired point on the board
        Returns:
        a Piece object at the given spot

      • getAllPieces

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getAllPieces()
        Gets all pieces that are still active on the board.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of type Piece

      • setPiece

        public static void setPiece(int i,
                            int j,
                            Piece p)
        Sets piece on the board at a given spot. Determined by indexes.
        Parameters:
        i - the desired row index
        j - the desired column index
        p - a Piece object indicating which piece to set

      • setPiece

        public static void setPiece(Point po,
                            Piece p)
        Sets piece on the baord at a given spot. Determined by a Point object.
        Parameters:
        po - a Point object indicating where to set the piece
        p - a Piece object indicating which piece to set

      • getInputAndConvert

        public static Point[] getInputAndConvert()
        Takes an input from a player in chess notation. Then, converts to standard index notation in order for the program to be simpler in its calculations. Stores converted notation in Point objects.
        Returns:
        an array of three Point objects

      • movePiece

        public static void movePiece(Point p1,
                             Point p2)
        Moves a piece at one spot to another spot.
        Parameters:
        p1 - a Point object representing the source
        p2 - a Point object representing the destination

      • promoteWhite

        public static void promoteWhite(Point p,
                                java.lang.String piece)
        Promotes a white piece at a spot to a possibly specified piece.
        Parameters:
        p - a Point object representing the spot of the promoted pawn
        piece - a possibly empty string possibly containing the new piece

      • promoteBlack

        public static void promoteBlack(Point p,
                                java.lang.String piece)
        Promotes a black piece at a spot to a possibly specified piece.
        Parameters:
        p - a Point object representing the spot of the promoted pawn
        piece - a possibly empty string possibly containing the new piece

      • whiteAttackingSpot

        public static boolean whiteAttackingSpot(Point po)
        Determines whether or not white is attacking a specified spot.
        Parameters:
        po - a Point object indicating which spot might be attacked
        Returns:
        true if white is attacking specified spot, and false otherwise

        public static boolean whiteWillBeInCheck(Point start,
                                         Point end)
        Determines whether or not white will be in check after a move.
        Parameters:
        start - a Point object that represents the source of the move
        end - a Point object that represents the destination of the move
        Returns:
        true if white will be in check after a move, and false otherwise
